cTsddDSU3HCXYdKH2toNnw.text: Juice Bars are easily my favourite things on this planet, from the whole fruit smoothies to the fruit and veg blended juice drinks, I am in love with it all. This is some of the best I've ever had. And I've tasted a lot.   I was in Hula Juice Bar today and had the Blue Hawaiian smoothie, which contains blueberries, strawberries, banana and apple, and was absolutely beautiful. I didn't try any food but I'll definitely be back to do so as it looks amazing. I have so many reasons to come back; hundreds of juice and smoothie combinations to try!  The venue itself is so accommodating and friendly. The vibrant colours and the eccentric mismatched chairs add a happy atmosphere, which is helped along by the friendly full-of-smiles staff, who seem to know quite a few of the regulars by name.   If you're craving a juice fix, I insist you head down to the Grassmarket and try some outstanding smoothies. You'll thank me later!

WkYQYg_0BArxlqj8O8vY4A.text: Fantastic place with fantastic staff!!  Combination of fresh and frozen fruit chosen to best suit the smmothie makle this one heck of a place. Amazing taste and produce these guys really exel healthy treats.  If you are a fan of hummous try theirs its top notch, staff are very helpful and will even consult with you on what smoothie you will enjoy based on your taste  Brilliant wee place means Jd = happy man!!

jIK61STAbV6mrxe1O5RSFw.text: I've come here a couple times to meet Miss Jenny L, and have really enjoyed being at Hula both times!   The staff here are so very welcoming, and are very nice about altering orders. I had come here once before and ordered a cinnamon latte. When I returned for my second visit, they didn't seem to have it on the menu. But when I asked about it, they were more than happy to make me one! Delicious..  They have just undergone renovations, and it looks great! A lot more Hawaiian/hula themed, and just as cosy as before!   The soups of the day are fantastic and I would highly recommend them. I've noticed that the ingredients they use seem very fresh. Definitely my lunch/coffee place of choice when hanging about the grassmarket!

of0sYvD_jMN1TeMhtGMZcw.text: Good for juice but staff not really friendly, crowded and  feel rushed as not much seating!  Was actually asked not to eat some food bought from the market inside even though me and my friend got drinks AND food!  Not very impressed and have been here multiple times.

Hva-4SvwMRe1Y3-QzFb7jw.text: At one point there were juice bars every where it felt like. Hula seems to have been here for ages. I often make a point of popping in on sunny days, hang over days etc for a take away juice to energise while wandering around town. The juices are great, not inexpensive and not expensive. Staff seem nice enough. I haven't tried the food but it looks nice if a little pricy for a sandwich. All in nice place with great juice.

AVpQC9i2XJPk9p7OKHTKqQ.text: I've only tried their pastries/desserts but they were very good and they have vegan options for anyone looking!

it9O3CmUnFuHLpJWgq6mWg.text: Hula is cute, quick and affordable - the lunch time menu soup and bagel/wrap is super cheap and filling. Smoothies are lovely too! If you're looking for a quick and quite healthy fix for lunch I'd definitely recommend this place. The Popeye juice is my favourite!

EciEybjBz9IzTwOYSyYWyg.text: Friendly service, smoothie was extra good but I didn't really enjoy the smoked salmon bagel...the salmon was ok but not the freshest. Bagel was crispy and yum though. We thought the price was a touch expensive compared to other places for what you get but overall a positive experience.

NqoOcgMr3Cxrbkdg9yWs8Q.text: Good as always. Had the pesto chicken and sun dried tomatoes on a bagel ! Plus for the meal deal for lunch and got the zesty tomato coriander soup! DELICIOUS!!!!  Love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pesto chicken and sun dried tomatoes on a bagel plus zesty tomato soup.

rW5WV-AtAAPcVXBHxuIMPA.text: a winter in edinburgh generally means grey days, cold and wet weather, and a total lack of colour and sunshine.  and then there is winter inside Hula Juice Bar...color, sunshine, smoothies full of fruity goodness!! oh yes, i felt like i'd stepped into summer time a few months early when i came here on tuesday night :)  the shop very kindly stayed open for an extra hour so the cake committee could come and meet about setting up a bake off for charity!  all very exciting, but made much more so with the dominant yellow colour that was on the walls, chairs, and counters of hula.  and then there are the juices, my betty ford was a pretty pink, the popeye was a lovely forrest green, and even Susan M's tea came in a beautiful blue teapot.   all delivered by friendly smiling staff :)  so yes the colourful environment was very pleasing, but so were the lovely juice blends they had!  i found myself debating between a few of them but went for the betty ford that was lovely and full of strawberries and peach with just a hint of banana.  it was just the pick up i needed after scoffing a birthday cupcake during the afternoon at work.  i left feeling revived and healthy and sunny even though it was dark and cold outside.  i'm definitely a fan of hula and hope to get back there soon to try some of their tasty food offerings in addition to more juice!  i only wish this place was closer to leith...or that they had a second shop in leith!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Betty Ford juice blend :)

r_l0dpoG1pHfA3_ocKgy7w.text: I am a smoothie-addict, and therefore I am quite fussy about what I drink. This place has not failed to impress me. The manager is a very friendly and dedicated lady and this adds to the quality of the experience. The menu is very rich and it always includes a fairly good selection of cakes.  I personally love thicker drinks, so I definitely appreciated the possibility of adding frozen yogurt for only 50p. It makes the smoothies absolutely outstanding without ruining the taste.  The place is very tidy and colorful, it offers free wi-fi and it's an option I would reccomend to anyone happening to be in that area.

GD1WBuJwNYOUuUTAaDDFwg.text: Last time, I gave Hula 4 stars - they charged for GF bread so that ticked me off. Didn't stop me from going though and I do visit more regularly than my check-in's suggest - namely because I head in, grab food and then have my hands too full to use the Yelp app (and iphones are fragile little darlings and don't react well to cobbles) as I'm walking up Victoria St.  I love Hula. When I'm tired I head to Hula. When I have crap hair and dodgy skin, I head to Hula. When I've walked into town and need refreshments, I head to Hula. So why is this? I love their smoothies and juices. As I said in my last review - I eat my veggies, but as far as I was concerned, veggies were for eating, not drinking. Now, I drink my veggies courtesy of the Popeye - spinach, apple, lemon and nutmeg. It is divine! It is my cold curer - get in there as soon as the sniffles start and if skin and hair looks ropey then I order a large Popeye and I soon have a ready-brek glow.  Food is great too :-) No charge now for GF bread - hurrah but something happened on my last visit. Something immense that only GF people can understand. Normally chicken soup is off limits. Creamy (not overly so) chicken soup, with chicken bits and is good for the soul, but usually comes packed with wheat flour so is off limits. But at Hula - I HAD CHICKEN SOUP FOR LUNCH AND IT WAS AWESOME! It was gf, had ginger in it - ha! potential cold had to go somewhere else after that - and it was so damn good and reminded me that I miss having chicken soup for my lunch if I'm out and about. I had the soup and sandwich deal (gf bread) which was tons of food with my sandwich packed full of spicy tuna and only 5. Worth more for the virtuous healthy feeling I had leaving Hula.  So, yep Hula is well worth a visit. You know already that it's a great wee colourful haven on a dark, cold winters day with friendly staff, free wifi, awesome drinks and food, so if its been awhile, its time to get reacquainted.

pRtETDDXnq0lBL9aLvYW1g.text: If you're backpacking and want to try a good non-chain, then you have found your spot.  Amazing place, cute and fun atmosphere. Delicious quick breakfast for me. The bagel/smoked salmon was delicious and I highly suggest either the hot chocolate or the nutty professor.  Free wifi, friendly staff and now I have the energy to start my day.

yP-PdH4lqrq_LXcGnwybJw.text: Now I know what all the fuss is about! I swear I've passed Hula by unaware of its very existence! And now, I find that in that very spot exists the infamous, wonderful smoothie hula haven I've heard so much about! (And they really do go to town on the hula theme!)   Hula is just the right sort of small to feel cosey and not cramped. The staff were super welcoming and it was great to see that we got 10% off our order when we checked in on Yelp. Hooray!  I went for the Betty Ford with strawberry, peach, apple and banana and my smoothie significant other went for a Ginger Jack fruit juice with carrot, ginger, apple and orange. Wow! I will not accept any less than the smoothie scrumminess that is Hula. They tasted like pure fruit and were blended to perfection.   With our yelp discount, it came to about the average cost for two large smoothies at any smoothie bar. But tasted like one of the best smoothies I've had. And I've had a fair few! (Got to get them fruits!) Now to say I'd get the train to Edinburgh just to get my Hula fix would be a crazy lie. (Boy, I wish I could!) But when I'm in town, it's first on my agenda!

AfRGxS0IbczRSpsXeDtpCA.text: 103-105 West Bow, EH1 2JP. Craving your daily greens juice or a really yummy breakfast? Here.  Emily Rose Reeder

V_ExXQPm6-VGjv8U6O4zsQ.text: Yay! Super fresh, delicious food served right quick and with a smile. Very reasonably priced as well, 5 starts!  Had read about this place a while back in the states and was happy to have it in my back pocket as a healthful choice.  Having indulged in numerous pints and various sausages through out my holiday, imagine my delight when I literally walked past this place around dinner time! It had a very tidy and cheery interior. Was waited on by a very pleasant young woman.   I decided on the soup/wrap Hula lunch combo, and a Popeye juice blend. All were very delicious, and again, well within budget. I felt healthier almost immediately! I'm sure I'll stop back before I leave Edinburgh.

jF5zOoI3UPEH6hR1hkJd_A.text: I was just visiting from the USA and needed my juice! LOVED this little place and well worth the find! Great healthy juices and food.

asYfB1ysdozNwpj_c8K8oA.text: Great Flat White and breakfast. Nice peoples.

shfjOKsZ23GY-l_jltDzrQ.text: AMAZING place. Great music and decor, and the food is top notch. Went in with my sister on a rainy day and had the soup and sandwich combo that truly hit the spot. The hot chocolate with cinnamon and honey may be the best thing I've EVER, like EVER tasted. Go go go!

ThqW0VQYKeFiIZD7-qvYVQ.text: Lots of character in the main part of the cafe but I was seated in the side room which had no atmosphere and had terrible acoustics.  Seated quickly and the service was prompt but wish I'd waited for  a table in the main part.  The decor is bright and funky, the art work being displayed is up for sale.  I Ordered the soup of the day mushroom with Stilton, it was accompanied with cheese on toast which was very tasty as the cheese was  Mull of Kintyre.  The bagel with baked ham and Mull of Kintyre  cheese was good also.  The milkshakes are delicious we ordered nutty professor, peanut butter, banana and frozen yogurt and frangipani,  banana, cinnamon, honey and frozen yogurt both delicious. Xoxo

R2e4sWO-EdzO4euuyOc7SQ.text: We were staying in the Grassmarket area, and after a night of drinking all I wanted was a green juice.  Low and behold, Hula appeared like a beacon and gave me what I needed.    I told them what I was looking for, and they recommended a juice not on the menu - all I can recall was mango and spinach (I think apple too?  Ginger?) but once I heard those things I was like - SOLD.  We got a wheatgrass "booster" too which didn't affect the taste like I thought it would, fortunately.  I think it was about 5 for a large with the booster.  Worth it!  My fiance and I shared it, though I drank most of it because it was so addictively good.  So fruity and yummy, you'd never know how many vegetables you were consuming!  I watched them make it, which was really fun, they have these crazy industrial blenders and just jam whole apples in there.  Service was really friendly, took a while to get the juice but the cafe was so cozy and cute that I didn't mind waiting.  We didn't eat there, but their menu looks so wonderful and healthy that I hope to grab a bite there another day.

znMoPIxb3vG2_4D7DD-quw.text: Went here on a whim and so glad we did!! The special salad was roasted carrot and sweet potato and I can easily say that it was the BEST salad I've ever had! Juice was amazing and my boyfriend got the parsnip soup that was also wonderful.  Prices were very reasonable on top on all that. All in all,  I love this place and will most definitely go back!

XxWxJSr_p-xv__AVUk3Sug.text: Awesome. Got the avocado toast with salmon and it came with a serious amount of avocado. Definitely get your money's worth. I liked the chili peppers on the avocado I've been feeling very deprived of peppers in the U.K. Espresso was good, not amazing but that isn't their specialty. My husband was very happy with his acai bowl.

LpgY7E9RWJTkJqcF04HEdA.text: This little cafe was a wonderful find!  We tried the acai bowl (which I now want to eat everyday for the rest of my life!) and a Scottish porridge with blueberries (will add this to my lifetime menu too!).  The waitstaff was quick and very pleasant.  I will definitely be back every chance I get!

5-0VhBAHVD0LVxjP3jw0Xw.text: I came by here to get some work done and treat myself to the Nutty Professor. It was a good smoothie, but I easily could have made it myself (if I wasn't living in student accommodation with no blender). The service was really slow, but that might have been because I was on my laptop so they didn't want to disturb me. The food and desserts looked really good, so if you're planning on sitting in, I would suggest getting a full meal and not just a smoothie.

_Jb1zTehceuuoPLCVtzLcg.text: It was a rainy day... One of those gray days that fit a miserable mood... I didn't want to me miserable.  Enter Hula.  Hula was like sunshine, with juices that taste like summer and toasts that taste like comfort.  Just come, you'd love it!

fz1SW9jQz2YPQ106-oixJw.text: Had a working lunch date with a friend recently - when we got in that morning she mentioned she'd only have a cup of tea, as she was on a bit of a fast - so lunch choice was up to me.  What a score to find Hula.   The decor is bright and tropical themed (as one would hope with a name like 'Hula' - it will help you forget a damp grey day for sure.  The front room was bustling, but there's a back room, and that was nice and quiet, we managed to have a great meeting over lunch back there.  She managed to have more than just that cup of tea she'd been planning on sipping - the juices on the menu fit into her plan that day, and the green one she picked out was really nice, tasted like 'home juiced' if that's a thing.   I had a spicy tuna wrap (chilli tuna, guacamole, rice, cheddar, mixed salads), it was a solid 'good', I remember feeling like it could've had 'more' - not sure what, cheese for sure, salsa would've lifted it beautifully, I don't remember thinking the rice added much.  The salad falls on the short lists of salads in restaurants I will eat - I remember it being full of bright, vivid colors (I am very picky about salads).    All in all, for price, convenience, quality of food, ability to accommodate me and my friend, it was the perfect spot for lunch that day.  I have since recommended Hula to a coworker who was out for a lunch a few days later.  He reported back that he liked it and would be back.   I work in the neighborhood and based on my own experience, and what I've read here - I'll pop back in sometime to try something else - a friend of mine has raved about the soups.  Might come back here after and add a star...

KRS5AsR7RjNNRCdoxMKTyA.text: If you are vegan/GF and traveling to Edinburgh, you MUST go here. Even if you have a normal diet and just want delicious, fresh, and quick food, Hula is the spot. I've spent hours browsing Yelp and other sites to find delicious food thay doesn't empty my wallet, and I've found it. The bagels and fresh juice are my go-to :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Banana honey porridge is delicious!

RgO2FK-RDO0WutpOIxcC-A.text: Hula is a place I have always wanted to like, and despite a few nice experiences here with smoothies/juice, I have a slightly "meh" feeling about it nowadays.   It wants to be a healthy cafe, it wants to be a hip eaterie, it's colourful and on Victoria street. There is wifi. It has a lot of potential.  I got soup today. Tasty, but at 4.25 a little on the steep side given that so many other places in town offer more for less. My friend paid around 5 for her smoothie, which though tasty was certainly not worth the high price tag.   I had a look at the cakes before leaving the shop, a few gluten free options but nothing particularly inspiring.

PTtYpa4pVN_XIzjCZPG6zg.text: This cafe is nestled along the Grassmarket, almost on the corner up a very steep street. It's very cozy and deceptively larger than I thought (but still not that big). There is outdoor seating along the front for nicer days. Inside in the main room there is some seating but if you venture in, there is more seating! Very comfy and cozy place.   We didn't stay, I ordered the Popeyes juice cause I love those super-jam-packed, full of vitamins and goodness type of juices. It was very tasty and my toddler approved. We also got a veggie wrap which had some creamy guacamole and loads of fresh crunchy veggies!   All in all  very tasty and one of the only places in Edinburgh to offer fresh juice. And by fresh juice I mean, freshly squeezed or liquified right  in front of you. None of this bottled none sense. Fresh and unapologetic.   Definitely will be coming back! Child friendly and good wholesome fresh food & juice. Really couldn't ask for more.

EjdIXsYe5oHHEZF98rR81w.text: This healthy cafe was directly around the corner from the flat we had while visiting Edinburgh and we enjoyed it so much that we visited 3 times.  It's a small spot, but with a lot of character and they like to highlight local artists on the walls. They have very impressive vegetarian and vegan options for those with dietary restrictions and they make truly wonderful smoothies if you're not in the mood for coffee or tea (seriously, you've got to try their awesome fresh fruit smoothies!).  They have some very unique menu creations which will keep you returning to try new dishes each time and nothing we tried was even remotely disappointing. Every bite was pure culinary genius!  If you're headed to Edinburgh, this is a really great place to get breakfast each morning.

yGuRU1lEit7vigiCNZu1_g.text: Gluten free food!!!!  Gluten free sandwiches were tasty as well as their many excellent juices. Staff is friendly and there is free, reliable wifi.

FZjuyaPxcj_RMDW2kg8S0A.text: The only real juice bar in Edinburgh at the time of this review. They use actual vegetables in their juices - like spinach and kale, which is nice. The drinks are a little sweet for a real juicer like me (a little too much apple), but still healthier than the fake sugar in most other mainstream juice places. And since juicing isn't really a thing there, some sweetness is to be expected.   So I can appreciate that they are trying to spread the juice culture to Edinburgh - they even had a class about why you should juice.   Nice people and good sandwiches/wraps as well. I hung out there and used their wifi while eating and drinking healthy stuff.

T16yZneL2P2KKa77lQNONg.text: We went there 3 times during our stay, so yes we liked it! The hot chocolate was excellent; it was in the top 3 I had in 2014. The wraps were also really good. This is an address I will keep for my next stay. Service was excellent each time. PS: don't go for the wifi, it was quite poor

sDZo_-L6Guo8mEd0RCFkfA.text: Hungover on New Year's Day and in need of some warmth and a drink, we hunted down Hula after checking Yelp for suggestions.  Located in a great spot for tourists checking out key areas in the city, it's in an ideal spot.  It looked warm and bright from the outside so we headed in with ideas of coffee and cake.  They were able to accommodate five of us in a back room that you wouldn't know existed if just looking in from the outside.   Decorated with lots of cute pictures of animals it was a fun place to spend an hour warming up, reliving tales of Hogmanay and cure our weary bodies.  Once we glanced at the menus we all swiftly changed from wanting coffees to wanting to try something from their extensive juice and smoothie menu.  I opted for a delicious and zingy smoothie of Apple, lime, ginger and lemon, with an added energy shot of guarana and ginseng. Just what the doctor ordered!   They had some lovely gluten free cakes on offer, but my smoothie was sufficient for me. Some of my friends got cakes though and really enjoyed them.  The smoothies very tasty and healthy, though a tad expensive at 5 for a large. We were pleased to find we could unlock a 10% off code when checking in on the Yelp app and so we had that knocked off our bill. Every little helps.  This is a really cute, wholesome cafe. A great little find.

chkKLqIRWMORPhciGdWVzg.text: Hula Juice Bar is THE coffee house for the social media crowd. There is free wifi for you to while away the hours as you enjoy the brilliant selection of smoothies (my personal favourite is the Whirling Dervish with an energy shot), coffees courtesy of Artisan Roast and the most amazing selection of cakes.   The ethos in Hula is definitely around making the customer feel important and you always feel the personal touch, even when it is incredibly busy which it usually is for most of the day. The new refurb has made the space a lot more open and the extra large windows give a great view of the passing crowds in the Grassmarket and Victoria Street.  I can't recommend Hula highly enough, if you are in that part of town, go in and try for yourself.

qXMiUOK3D7hJWQ01sXaq6A.text: I am a full blown addict to The Ginger Jack, Pink Lady and any green juice specials from Hula.   It is well placed at the end of Victoria Street, in the Grassmarket area of Edinburgh and it is so bright and welcoming that it is hard not to love even before you have tasted the juices & smoothies.  Run by Susan and her lovely, friendly staff you will leave feeling healthier than when you entered.  I have also partaken in the 3 day juice cleanse that delivers 6 juices a day to you at home. Each and every one was lip-smackingly good and you even get a list of when you drink each juice, so your energy levels stay up.  I highly recommend popping in here for lunch or a pick me up take away juice and if you want a juice cleanse, this is the best place & service in Edinburgh .

ZP17-8qA9OygKsX7PasUQA.text: It was a sight for sore eyes and feet to finally be able to eat a great salad and have a great shake. The staff is friendly and the food is great. I also had the soup of the day and it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great feel and friendly staff.

vTwpzcCRSxghLVAWW_tyYg.text: Food very nice, good lunch deal where you can get soup and a sandwich for 6 odds. A good place for a pit stop when you're out and about; everything tastes fresh and good quality. Must say that the soups are especially good.  As for smoothies, I've only ever had the banana and peanut butter one. Gosh, it was good. I'm sure the wide selection of juices on offer will do the owner proud. Smoothies are a bit steep - it's almost 4 for some of them. But for a treat you could do an awful lot worse!   Pleasant ambience in the cafe - plenty of seats to rest your weary toosh, and there's a section through the back if it's all looking busy when you first step in the door. Also like the art from local artists that is hung on the walls.

VMYFITuQh7TGMMTUT6DQXA.text: We were looking for somewhere to have a good quick lunch and we found it!   I'm recently a bit of a smoothie addict and there is nothing I love more than a creamy banana smoothie and so I was delighted when I got one here!  We also had lunch here, I had a Cajun chicken wrap which was lovely and so filling! My boyfriend had the cream cheese and salmon bagel which he also devoured!  I was surprised to see there was 10% off the bill when you check in with Yelp which was a cheeky bonus!

ITB6IdMlnt0F6GnzwqIKRw.text: I'm not a huge smoothie fan, but I popped in here and was quite happy. Hula is a smallish cafe just off the Grassmarket, and is loosely themed on Hawaii. I saw loosely because the decor consisted of a few hula skirts.   They offer a range of smoothies and will even add anti oxidants or energy boosts to your chosen drink. I had a Betty Ford smoothie, which I think was banana, peach and I'm going to say strawberry. See that is why I'm not a huge smoothie fan, because they all taste the same no matter what you put in them. After I ordered I noticed Tiffin Milkshake was the special of the day and was gutted I hadn't gone for that. The nice girl made the smoothie in front of me while multi tasking by serving the people seated as well. Hula also do sandwiches and soup so great for a quick lunch. Not too overpriced either considering it is in tourist territory.

VHVrpG4e_0UredmIvujNAQ.text: Fantastic breakfast / lunch spot especially for those with gluten and dairy sensitivity plus they have wonderful coffee. Do it.

FHIPosx7RvxbZCJd7zav8A.text: Really friendly! great and healthy snacks! try the nutty professor banna and peanut butter milkshake (with frozen yoghurt rather than ice cream so a bit healthier!)

1lmhMD81SqRCLb7Y9wrrWw.text: I had an absolutely fantastic breakfast, and overall experience, at Hula. I had a bagel with brie cheese, cranberry, and tomato, and it was just delicious. The brie cheese melted on the warm, perfectly-toasted bagel and created a gooey and tasty sandwich. My coffee was fresh and strong, some of the best I've had in a long time.  I left feeling completely satisfied and happy with the meal. As I strolled by the storefront about 10 minutes later, a staff member was setting up chairs outside and flagged me down, saying she was so happy to catch me because she had accidentally charged me a few pounds too much. Honest to boot - they could have easily written me off as a gullible tourist, but chose to take the high road. I will definitely be back to Hula to try more of their menu!

96snCGSUpg-KXu7Me-mcEg.text: I used to think that the only way to cure a stonking hangover was a can of cold Diet Irn Bru and a fry up, but I have recently discovered a new cure which I can officially recommend.   After downing a couple of Alka Seltzers, head to a smoothie bar and grab a banana and Manuka honey smoothie with a shot of Wheatgrass in it. I promise you that you'll be right as rain in no time!  Hula are a small chain of juice bars around Edinburgh, and no-one can whip up a smoothie quite like them. Delicious, cold, packed with whole fruit and at prices that won't break the bank. Do it!

ncsLJRrkx81vX8MbYEdF_g.text: friendly staff, lovely interior, and good food and juice offerings. i had the sunshine in a cup and it was sweetly tart and yummy. my boyfriend opted for the nutty professor and finished it in a second, so i think he definitely enjoyed it!

f7DjEY6n_B5oyBbhra78CQ.text: After a week of greasy fry-ups during our week in Edinburgh, we checked this place out, hoping for a delicious healthy breakfast. And I'm glad we did! The food was excellent...I had a most delicious fruit salad, which was topped with granola, yogurt, honey, and a berry sauce. There were several types of fruit, all of it ripe, delicious, and beautifully presented. My husband had a pesto & chicken bagel with brie, which he loved. I'll admit, I was eyeing up everyone's food at our neighboring tables, and everything looked scrumptious...especially the thick slices of whole grain toast with peanut butter. Yum. Unfortunately, I have to knock off a star for the rather slow service...our empty plates sat in front of us for ages while our server absentmindedly peeled fruit behind the counter. We finally had to go over and flag her down to get our check.  But overall a good experience, and  I will definitely come back here the next time we are in Edinburgh!

XcFYXxktyeFqj6DJlXu0kQ.text: Looking for a bite, or to pick from the vast selection of very tasty smoothies, or a good coffee to start a day, this is your place. The staff is so relaxed and unobtrusive ... And food is descent as well.

UP7QBTABuyhUXbHWuefJUQ.text: Hula offers delicious juices and smoothies in a distinctly surfy laid-back setting. But it's not all healthy, you can balance those 'calories-saved' on one of their delicious cakes. The juice bar also doubles as a gallery, previewing up and coming artists works and offering a stage for latest collections. Only drawback is that there is no loo as yet, but there's a back-scratching deal with the pub next door.

5o2ncbvdlvLCEhlnv9Cc-w.text: Looking for a bite, or to pick from the vast selection of very tasty smoothies, or a good coffee to start a day, this is your place. The staff is so relaxed and unobtrusive  And food is descent as well.

zJ6VsFTjX2Sl4RZYuRikxA.text: I love everything on offer here and want to try everything from the detoxifying smoothie, to the immunity boosting smoothie just after I try this Betty ford! I feel healthier already, think I might just treat myself to a delicious piece of chocolate brownie! Well done me!  Will never be away from hula in the summer!

hsCc49m8AnroisbJCt94LA.text: Cheerful little cafe located in the Grassmarket area bursting with healthy foods and chirpy staff.   I really liked Hula and not sure why I've been there only once before! It was a Saturday morning and I was feeling a little 'delicate' and decided that a restorative breakfast was just what I needed. I ordered a cappuccino, regular orange juice (freshly squeezed of course since it's a juice bar!) and a sourdough toast with avocado and extra of 2 slice of bacon. The orange juice arrived first, ice cubes mixed in for a cooling effect - it was perfect. The avocado toast was lovely too, it had a sprinkling of chili flakes (or Hula fairy dust as they call it) and looked great (simple slices of avocado, not mashed).   The total was 11.90 but I checked in on yelp and received a 10% discount which was a nice little bonus.  Next time I want to try some of their healthy juices!

T5T-6ur8s2nN5mc7PHZX7Q.text: Hula is a good and place to go for a smoothie when energy boost is needed. In addition, it offers cute seating and an opportunity to just enjoy or even buy works of some contemporary local artists.  I was pleased with my drink and the service - I went for my favourite refreshing green smoothie with spinach, apple and acai.  Good to know Yelp Check in gives a 10% discount as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. gallery at Hula
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. smoothie time

trs1uxqt4TSJQNjDYsxNrA.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Hula yet. I love this place!   They have great lunch, but most recently I was here for breakfast. Since I was staying overnight in Edinburgh, just across the street from Hula, I finally had a good excuse to go here for my porridge. As a bit of a morning ritual, I normally have a porridge and a big cup or pot of loose breakfast tea. So I was extremely happy to find out that I could have both of these things for breakfast here.   After reading through the menu of porridge options I decided to go with their popular honey and blueberry porridge. I thoroughly enjoyed this with it's natural sweetness... and they give you a HUGE bowl of it. I had a lovely pot of Breakfast tea to accompany said porridge, and was more than pleased that they serve it at a nice strength unlike many other Edinburgh cafes.   I'm always happy to return to Hula, and hope I get another chance for breakfast there in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Porridge with blueberries and honey

mpH4v4ou39pnYY2OgXAxrA.text: Hula is a bright little oasis in the windy, rainy streets of Edinburgh. We stopped here for a brief respite from the weather and I'm glad we did. The atmosphere is lively and bright and the menu has some really delightful looking bagels that I unfortunately couldn't partake in as we were to eat soon. I hesitated between a milkshake and some frozen yogurt (the obvious choices on a cold rainy day, no?) and opted for the latter topped with fruit coulis and granola. My boyfriend had green tea and a slice of carrot cake. I have to say I'm not a hardcore carrot cake fan but it was really good. He had never tried it and was also impressed.   What's more you get 10% off the bill for checking in on Yelp. If I was actually living in Edinburgh and not just visiting, I could see this place being a regular stop for me!

AU4vpjNyLSVpUOHuq2P0uw.text: Hula hits the spot!   This was my second visit to Hula, and it was just as impressive as the first. On a warm, sunny beautiful day in Edinburgh my esteemed colleague and I popped in for a healthful lunch. I had the Mexican hot wrap (tuna, avocado, veggies) and the house salad (bleu cheese, walnuts, apples)...GORGEOUS. Simply wonderful, and just what I had wanted.   Followed with a delicious smoothie (hold the banana!) with rasperries, strawberries, blueberries and an antioxidant booster for good measure I felt a wee spring in my step as I exited.   The staff are ever-so-lovely and unfailingly helpful. The place is a rainbow of colors and offerings, many items gluten-free, veggie-friendly, etc. Their listings of juices, smoothies, boosters and concoctions must be unparalleled! ALL THE JUICE. ALL THE FRUITS. ALL THE VEGGIES. (And some cakes, for good measure, of course!)   A must-stop in Edinburgh, will not disappoint .  *free wifi (easy connection, passwords on tables!)  *many outside tables in good weather, great location on a beautiful, bustling street.

9a1gNcMXIjvOmBv5ONkEiA.text: Was looking for somewhere to read through some journals whilst enjoying a comforting Latte.   Coffee was really good. I would say it's up there with the best coffee places in Edinburgh.   The only reason It doesn't get my full rating is because of the atmosphere. Although it's nice place it doesn't give you that warm feeling that will make it your regular.   Overall though great staff and good coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Fi7_683kXeSrLTZn6cRYzQ.text: Absolutely loved this little cafe. Went here several times over the few days we stayed in Edinburgh. Fair prices. Tried the avocado toast, acai bowl and ginger jack juice! All delicious. Would definitely recommend!!

my2h0SA1zmpyoW9WhzyUFA.text: If you're a peanut butter fiend like myself, you need to get your butt to Hula and treat yourself to a Nutty Professor shake. It will CHANGE YOUR LIFE. Or at least help with your hangover! You can get organic booster powders added too, so if you need some extra pep (or again, a hangover cure), you're in the right place. The food is affordable and uber-healthy, the people are lovely and the wifi is spot on. Added bonus: they have a lovely location right on Victoria Street, with seats outside for sunny days. Sheer bliss!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beetroot &amp; Betty Ford shakes at Hula Juice Bar

bdsIR7hZZOsRcZv3aGpwjg.text: Ooooh.... Believe me I wanted to give this place 5 stars! In need for some healthier food I decided to make a special trip to this placed, based on the reviews here in Yelp. Yes, ok, that probably raised my expectations quite high!  Cute place, love the colorfulness. Looked for healthy options but ended up with the bagel with salmon and tomato soup. It was 'OK', nothing extraordinary... I do have to say I might be a little spoiled healthy food places wise, but so 'healthy' I wouldn't call bagels with some toppings. Another time I had the chicken pesto bagel to go but all the chicken was on 1 side and the fresh tomato on the other.  Quite steep prices and nothing that blew me away... Have not found other 'healthier' options around yet so I do understand the popularity, but really a bit under impressed. They do are very proud of their status here on yelp and offer a special discount when you check in in the restaurant! At least at the time I was there.  Not bad, not amazing, quite expensive, cute interior, thats it...

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

qSt68YqlrFsqdWsJw6arWg.text: Hula used to be my 'oh god I'm going to be in the studio all day I better eat something sustaining and vaguely healthy so that I don't die' go to. Its a bit quirky, with bright colours and illustrations on the wall. It seems to attract the health conscious folk of Edinburgh, but I mainly went in for the excellent bagels. Those huge oversized polo shaped guiltiness can be filled with a variety of things, but I went for the unhealthiest you can manage in this shop, cream cheese.  They also do lots of nice things, and super coloured juices that I am slightly afraid of.  Great place to get a quick bite while in the grassmarket.

T0EdfuTxMf_x-a7hQfsfjw.text: We had wonderful breakfast here! The juices were fresh and delicious!  I really enjoyed the salmon bagel toast and the rarotonga shake!  the only reason we didnt gave the perfect 5 stars score is the fact that the lattice leaves wasn't that fresh unfortunately.   Highly recommended!  We will defiantly come back

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zpgp2Mgkm97pGxL48erZtw.text: This place is a lot cosier and warmer inside than it looks outside. I retreated from a bitter Edinburgh cross wind into Hula and happily chilled with my laptop for a couple of hours. Their wifi is great and there are loads of small tables so you don't need to take up lots of space or feel the need to be rushed out.  The service was great - happy workers equal happy customers.   If I'm being honest, my salad looked a lot better than it tasted. Don't get me wrong, it was perfectly nice, but just lacking in some thought about the mixture of flavours. I got carrot and coriander soup though which was lovely and hearty, if a bit on the thin side.   I would go back.

nX2x8CmFYQDtXDakzBAwWQ.text: Every time I pop into this little lovely oasis I feel all tropical and summer has arrived!  No matter rain or shine, smoothie or hot chocolate with cinnamon & honey - this place will melt your heart!  The coffee is by artisan roast and I usually go for a flat white but somehow I opt for a all black. I'm not sure why but it just warms me through on a dull winters day and lasts a tad longer!   If I stop here for lunch I go for the wrap and soup deal. Not only a tasty wrap and bowlful, it's awesome for value too. I ponder usually on what wrap I go for as I get stuck between the veggie and the tuna!   The staff are always so nice and chatty, so even on the dullest of dull days this little corner of sun will burn the clouds away!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Yum lunch time!

3kRtagx7uoYn6Br48KsOjg.text: Delicious AND healthy - just what I like to hear! This place is a real gem in Edinburgh and if you haven't tried it already then I suggest you get your butt down there immediately!  First of all, there's nothing worse than opting for the healthy option and then having to endure tasteless, boring rabbit food. That's miserable, quite frankly, and nobody wants to pay for that! Luckily for Edinburgh, Hula serves nice healthy food that you can feel good about eating, that tastes amazing!  To drink, I had the Pop-Eye juice, whose main component was spinach, if I recall correctly. Now, for me, choosing to drink spinach is a bold move, and always a risk... but it tasted fab! It was just fruity enough to take the edge of the vegetables, but not so fruity that it felt like it was packed with sugar. The portion was large and it was freshly made right there and then (as it should be) by the lovely and friendly staff. All in all, a great (healthy) juice!  I then had their hummus salad to eat, which was equally delicious. Packed with flavour, this dish was full of great taste, textures and ingredients. I finished the whole thing and felt decidedly satisfied at the end of it! :)  The place itself is very cute too, though it was a little noisy at points because of the juicing! We also suffered a little wifi breakdown while we were there, however I'm still marking these guys as a 5 star, because if you want perfect wifi, go to Starbucks! The menu and food here was too good to deduct a star for technical difficulties, in my opinion!   What a great little find in Edinburgh! I'll be back here again, for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pop-eye fresh juice.
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Amazing hummus salad!

fYXduLJyiBBnu_C2DTVQvA.text: I will never understand how it took me so long to get around to coming here. And if I'm not back within two weeks then I shall eat my hat.  Because first of all... Colour. It is like walking into a rainbow of happiness. The walls are made of colours and on them are fluorescent vinyls painted with adorable characters and scenes (these are for sale and I would like one please if anyone reading this is looking for a present for me).  Aurelie M and I were lucky to get a table - we arrived right at the start of the lunch wave; ten minutes later and it could have been curtains for our lunch plans. Lacy, gently wafting curtains...  I opted for the Cajun wrap, which was wonderful, toasted to crispness on the outside and burrito-like in contents. With the side salad it was the perfect amount. I also had the Betty Ford juice, which was delicious and tasted very wholesome. I tried Aurelie's Pink lady too and it was SO GOOD. I want a whole one to myself!  Aside from a slightly perfuctory dump-dishes-and-run moment from the staff member so brought our orders (totally understandable given that the place was packed by then) this was a wonderful experience from start to finish and we never felt rushed to move on despite the people who never stopped appearing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegan courgette cake by @MrsCsCakes with froyo at @HulaJuiceBar. Mad good stuff, y&#39;all.
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Soup and wrap deal
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pretty hot choc

tLYP4cTTvMnjgBd0noMopg.text: Walked all the way here because I was craving something sweet but am allergic to dairy. I was really excited to try one of the raw cakes but they didn't have any on the day I was there which was really disappointing. Had a matcha latte that was pretty good, and lots of menu items looked yummy. I guess I'll have to give it a second chance sometime!

H7M6uKRbtdHcOv2o_tJqWQ.text: Loved the Scottish salmon bagel!!! Warm and crispy bagel, with just the right amount of smoked salmon! I must said, smoked salmon in the UK tastes better than those we get in Australia, it's not as salty! Love love love!

TeeZDpENMi-mHXFvX71I6A.text: My goodness, how have I not reviewed hula yet!  Hula is a mad healthy bunch and juice bar. They do sandwiches, soups, bagels, wraps, and salads. All of which can be accompanied with something from their selection of freshly squeezed juices, smoothies or coffees and teas.   This place definitely has its dietary options down. Gluten free, vegan, they've got it covered with loads of options for making certain dishes vegan if they aren't on the menu.   I'm a little guilty of ordering the same chicken pesto bagel when I'm here so I don't have a great idea of how good everything else is on the menu. The juices and smoothies are amazing however. I've tried almost all of them and they're all delicious. The added boosters make them even healthier! Today I am enjoying the delightfully festive got Apple pie smoothie. Apple, cinnamon, hint of ginger, heated up! Yummo!   The coffee here is some of the best I've tasted in Edinburgh too.   Another very cool thing about hula is that it's not just a cafe, it's a gallery too. The place is full of bright colourful art from a different local artist every few months. There are also other things like Christmas cards and loose teas for sale here too. It's a lovely representation of how into local business Hula are, sharing their space for mutual benefit!

4xXkg0rmRBGx7wILkQImYw.text: Hula is a cheerful and warming spot, especially on the gray winter days while we were in Edinburgh.  It is well-located right off of Grassmarket on the sloping Victoria Street (filled with its own delicious wonders), and was the husband and my favorite place for breakfast during our few days exploring the city.  The staff was incredibly friendly and gave helpful recommendations, not just about the fare but also about local places to check out around Edinburgh.  Their porridge made me really love Scottish porridge, and their hot drinks (teas, coffee, espresso drinks) were well made.  It was also the first place where we tried a flat white, which hasn't made its way to the "colonies" (aka the US).  And they stock our favorite porridge bars (a great upgrade from the sad, hard granola bars we know across the Atlantic).  I know Hula is called a juice bar, but for some odd reason - perhaps the hour of the day - we never got juice there.  Next time, though!  I'm looking forward to dropping in on our next visit.

K_RwfhKHCSBQ8Xsj5BJ0dA.text: The new refurbishment is lovely! More importantly the food honestly keeps getting better, and things like the the coconut bowls are such lovely touches. The raw, vegan & gluten free cakes are so consistently delicious, and easy on the conscience. Even my friend who doesn't normally eat at more health based cafes was sceptical but loved the granary toast. The only thing I personally would like is more of a cross over time between breakfast and lunch options, or even all day breakfast options! Though, that's probably a logistical nightmare, so understand the lack of avo toast in afternoons! It's lovely to see Hula so busy all the time, seems to be super popular and rightly so!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Acai bowl, avo toast, turmeric latte &amp; green tea!

VUe2FBBIxMe1SI1WYENB9Q.text: We had their soups (highly recommend the spinach masala!), sandwiches and dessert - everything was vegan and super delicious! Service was also great! It has a very modest store front at the foothill near the famous Victoria St (Diagon Alley inspiration for Harry Potter fans!)  Highly recommend this for vegetarians and vegans!

vjt9jOL-brurCABhvvYGpw.text: Hula has been a go-to spot for me in Edinburgh for ages now and I'm very ashamed to see I never reviewed it. Until now!   Hula is such a lovely place and with their recent refurb, it really is an oasis - lush, green, tropical and bright - it's very welcoming and relaxing. We grabbed a seat out the back (this area didn't used to be there, did it?) and were pleased to see they have table service. I had a mint tea (properly brewed with actual mint leaves) and a piece of carrot cake which was just divine.   While the wifi out the back isn't amazing, I didn't let that spoil my visit. I can't wait to come back to properly try out the food!   Note: they have customer loos and lots of seating, but it does get really busy as the place is very popular!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Carrot cake and mint tea

RnhDPAGGeUKd1mm4LfsO_g.text: Managed to nab a seat during lunchtime rush on a busy Saturday in the city. Although small the cafe has a nice amount of seating and doesn't feel too crowded even when full which is nice.   Myself and my lunch date were both feeling something light so opted for salads: the watermelon olive and feta for myself and fig and prosciutto for my mum. These we accompanied with a Popeyes and oscars smoothie respectively. The juices came quickly and were both delicious, light and nutritious. The salads soon followed and lived up to expectations. The watermelon salad was bursting with fresh juicy watermelon, balanced with salty feta and topped with a sweet dressing and seed mix.  While the smoothies were expensive at 4 pounds for a regular size you can't really expect anything else for fresh juice? I would recommend Hula for anyone looking for a light fresh lunch and intend on coming back ASAP to sample the extensive breakfast menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Watermelon olive and feta salad on bottom, fig and prosciutto salad on top, Popeyes and Oscars juices in the middle.

Ib8uARKw32axg7TElw-byA.text: It's been 2 years since i stumbled upon this spot while on vacation. I just searched for it right now because I still think about the pink lady juice and need to know the ingredients.

b4_zDu_ffTvw13SHtDlYXg.text: I was quite impressed with this place - even though at first I thought 'oh no, it's cramped and full of tourists' - not seeing the large room to the back with loads of space to chillax!   But we were actually looking to work on our laptops so chillaxing wasn't the number 1 agenda item and with on and off wifi it was very much perfect for the heavy brainstorming we had in mind as opposed to internet heavy donkey work!  Great selection of cakes (the carrot and caramel brownie were great) and coffee was tasty. I didn't venture into juice land but seemed pretty good in terms of selection.   Good stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great to see it still being repped :-)

qxeCcCCL4WXtla4e2yun-Q.text: I loved my lunch here!  it was an oasis in Edinburgh.  I love the pub food of course, but really needed a colorful, vegetarian, whole food meal.  Even if that's not what I was seeking, the food was delicious. The raw food "snickers" was also a very special treat. Will go back when I'm back in town!!!

add034SF89Uzwe7AdcDkDw.text: My husband and I came here for breakfast while on holiday in Edinburgh. We ordered a smoothie, caffe latte, porridge with cinnamon, and fruit bowl (yogurt. Granola, and fruit), all of which was extremely delicious, and came to about 15.   It has a comfortable seating area with a cool artist atmosphere, and the employees were all very friendly and efficient as well. Would recommend for anyone looking for a delicious, healthy stop a few minutes from the Castle.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Entryway and seating area

B_H6FWNYZ1AKP3xPC7NcYw.text: This was my go to breakfast spot in Edinburgh. After a long flight I really wanted to eat something healthy so I wouldn't catch a cold. I had the avocado toast and a juice most mornings I was there. It became a home away from home. I got the ginger jack juice and it was lovely.

nIlpO4VZgP34Dyit6_tCjQ.text: Stopped in on my last day in Edinburgh and was floored by the incredible avocado toast and juice!!

SM90uys8W-gLeC-KXCB5cw.text: This is officially now one of my favorite places to eat in Edinburgh! I had the Harissa Chicken Sourdough Sandwich and a cappuccino, both absolutely delicious, and then I finished it off with a carrot cake that was divine. Lovely service, nice environment, and located on the quaintest street in all of Edinburgh.   Cannot recommend this place enough.

ku8twt7qG_lVYQcFPEFmgQ.text: I really wanted to love this place, but its going to be a hard pass for me. I ordered the vegan poke bowl and was beyond disappointed. I certainly wasn't expecting a huge portion, but the bowl came with three tiny pieces of tofu, 1/2 kale leaf, and this super spicy seasoning powder that failed to add flavor to the dish. It just wasn't good.   The good thing is, their menu is pretty big. I am sure there are a number of great items, their vegan poke bowl just isn't one of them.

JsH7Ysadbki_akGGxbwN0Q.text: Hula is the perfect place to eat if you're trying to be healthy. It's casual and friendly so great for a catch up.   They do a great selection of juices and smoothies. I especially like the hot juices, they give you the warmth of a coffee with out the caffeine. If you're looking for a boost then the hot apple pie has ginger and cinnamon so will keep you going through the afternoon.  They have a variable selection of cakes, some days they run out by late afternoon so check on the way in.   The wifi is also free and a good speed so it's a good location to work from too.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Peanut butter brownies
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Apple Pie - hot apple, ginger, honey and cinnamon

EG_0khn0MItkn-jagirExQ.text: Our hotel was literally around the corner from Hula, on Grassmarket Square, we discovered Hula Juice Bar on our first morning, when we had hearty, long-cooked oatmeal (porridge) and a pot of tea. After our first experience, we ate there almost every day. Many mornings, I had a bowl of flavorful, creamy yogurt with fresh local fruit and granola (pictured).  Hula is way more than a juice bar - there are soups, salads, wraps, and, at dinner, a hot dish. Although much of it is vegetarian, there is also chicken on the menu. I heartily recommend their soup of the day - someone in the kitchen has superb skills when it comes to seasoning, and I (a very choosy eater) throughly enjoyed everything I had there. Try a soup of the day with a slab of their "doorstop bread" with melted cheese! And enjoy trying out some of the great smoothie/juice choices.  The atmosphere is informal and cheerful. They seat you quickly, and the people who work there are very friendly. On our second morning, our server greeted us with, "Welcome back!"

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious and Healthy

kcgUHZR-ENM9Uvvp9BQkRg.text: As one of the few predominant vegan options in Edinburgh, we had high hopes for Hula, so much so that we came back to the restaurant on 4 different occasions during the month of August.  The Food: fresh ingredients, tasty and decently prepared.  The Service: waitresses are uninformed about the food that they are serving. Not only are the ingredients in the food not listed on the menu, when you ask the waitresses what is in the food they don't know.  We asked about the mixed veggies in one of the sandwiches and the waitress couldn't even tell us whether it was cooked or raw. When we asked what was in it she listed the wrong ingredients and we spoke with her 3 different times before she finally went and asked.  I ordered the rainbow bowl and it came with ingredients different than what was listed on the board and different than what the waitress told me. On another occasion we ordered the vegan poke bowl and it came with avocado smash which we didn't order. When we asked her if we'd be charged for it she looked confused and then informed us that they were out of tofu and automatically replaced it, only asking if it was okay after we'd been served. If you have food allergies, I would absolutely avoid this restaurant.  Ps: it was different wait staff each time.   Tldr: the food was good if you don't mind not knowing what you're getting, but not worth the rude and incompetent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

RtINozX8jBfDh1oUyhb-Dg.text: This place was PACKED! Came in for a juice and a snack. The coffees here are really good, and the smoothie I got (forgot which one) was good but pretty sour. I recommend getting some frozen yogurt in there if you get one of the vitamin c packed smoothies. We also tried their desserts: the "raw" snickers cake was pretty good!   There's lots of healthy options and vegetarian options if that's something you're looking for. We didn't try any, but definitely would next time.

OOc40F9Ncls04yWjHH6NEg.text: Everything here is so great!! Cute cozy decor and food is SOOO amazing. I ordered the avocado toast with salmon and they were so generous with their portion. The warm juice drinks were delicious and really warms you up on a cold day. Wish I lived here so I can get it everyday.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3Z-sDsrZwXp7CKjyqFOXHg.text: I really enjoyed the "Blue Hawaiian" smoothie (blueberry, mango, banana, orange) I bought at this joint. It was tangy and gave me an extra kick with the extra energy boost.  It was a little tricky to find because it wasn't exactly where Yelp said it was ( turned out it was slightly more down the block on the next street).  The place was in high attendance and has both inside and outside seating. And there is definitely more space inside than pictures let on so don't be afraid to bring a group and take a seat!  My only complaint about the atmosphere was that the temperature was a little warmer than I think was generally comfortable.  They have free wifi there so it would seem like a good place to get some work done, provided you're put off by all the noise of people talking and the noise from the machines preparing food.  Bottom line: a good place to stop off from your weary touristy travels of sightseeing and window shopping. Give yourself a break (and a boost) and go to Hula's!

LOh8u1wW_xs1K9hDg-wVVg.text: Hula is one of those spots I frequent after i've been binge eating junk food. It's literally impossible not to feel healthy here  - from the quirky patio furniture to the tea towels on the walls and astroturf at the front, you basically lose three pounds just walking in the door* (*results may vary).  I frequent this place most when i'm feeling a wee bit homesick. It's a little snippet of my yoga crazy, green juice chugging, home town tucked away in the Grassmarket.   Like most brilliant health conscious places - they make you feel good about eating cream cheese. I'm serious, you will feel like a million bucks for choosing that smoked salmon and cream cheese bagel. Is it the healthiest thing on the menu? Heck no. But you're also having a peppermint tea and a green juice, so that cancels out any harm caused by your full fat dairy indulgence: science.  This theory works with most of their menu. Delicious, healthy options with a heck ton of cheese - often melted. God bless you Hula.  Don't get me wrong, if you want to go the True blue health route, it has you covered as well. From heart healthy salads to house made soup - you can find a decent meal here with or without cheese cheating.  Bonus points for gluten free options.  It also boasts the best juice selection i've found thus far in Edinburgh and *drum roll please* - they carry green juice! Add a scoop of frozen yogurt and have a double lunch!  Hula will continue to be my go-to when I want to feel hip, healthy and/or need a quirky spot to host a lunch meeting. My only complaint? I wish they had better wifi. This gal needs to internet gush 24/7.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Popeye juice - spinach, apple and nutmeg
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3mloyKUmd-teVYSbpv1CtA.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! I was staying at the Apex and was so happy to find this spot- gluten free, vegetarian options galore! The food is fresh, the prices are insanely reasonable, and everyone who works there is incredibly nice. I wish they'd open one in the states!

1OkCOh41_iTl2pvFQy0VvQ.text: This cafe was my favorite to go to after I worked out or was feeling healthy. The acai bowl and poke are to die for. Everything is also served very prettily for pictures. A must-go in Edinburgh!

vSPvikj8DEFMiEy0wqazBA.text: Came here for lunch. We ordered chicken sandwich and tricolor salad. Both good, but nothing special!

CJW_ArsYKA5EOgXs4P13CQ.text: We went for a healthy breakfast in Edinburgh, and it had its ups and downs. I ordered a cinnamon latte and acai bowl. The coffee was very good. The bowl however was average at best. It had no flavor and not enough fresh fruit. There was also something in the mix (I think maybe granola) that had a very sour aftertaste. I let my mom test it (we love bowls) and she agreed something was off. My mother also ordered an avocado toast, juice, and a regular latte. She liked the avocado toast a lot and said the juice was amazing. I don't remember the exact one she chose but I think it was ginger flavored. Overall, not sure I would come back here. Apparently the cold press juice is the way to go.

uDXPlSZnFUlK98I0SbjHAg.text: Hula was the perfect little breakfast spot in Edinburgh. We wanted a quick breakfast and a smoothie, so we came here. I tried the porridge (needed more honey) but the cinnamon was good. I asked for more though because after eating half, it was getting bland.   My boyfriend got the salmon open face sandwich. It had a lot of ingredients on it and it seemed full of flavor. Price was reasonable for the quality of dish I though. The green smoothie I got was delicious. Ambiance was so cute too. Jungle themed in there with cute coconuts for silverware on the tables. I loved it.   I definitely recommend if you are visiting Edinburgh and want a breakfast that won't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Bk5hfz_bEbTyWVlVBMBqBA.text: Absolute great service, super friendly. Also the menu is exceptional, would've chosen everything if I could've  went for lunch - it was fab. Going again for breakfast soon. Delicious, healthy and a big variety. Lovely interior and atmosphere, quite quiet but nice choice in music. Enjoyed thoroughly with free magazines that I took an interest in :))

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The falafel wrap  but a bit on the surprisingly spicy side (with wayyyy too much onion, but oh well)
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious sourdough avocado  toast, available for breakfast and lunch.
Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. super cute Matcha Latte  with Camomile Tea.

uIZJVbO3Qwk57xDazZh9qQ.text: Delicious and pleasant first breakfast of our trip. Tea, coffee, and terrific porridge

fiBZEp3GiSy6gnulGQeK6g.text: I was looking for avocado toast for breakfast and found this cute place close by. They have a few small tables with servers, and also a front counter for take away. I ordered the avocado toast and decided on the pink lady juice. I don't drink juice often, but this did not seem like it was made correctly. It was a simple four ingredient drink, but all I could taste was an overwhelming ginger. I tried a few more sips but could not even, it was just too strong. I would have complained if anyone asked me how my food or drink was, but I was never checked on. The avocado toast was pretty tasty, but I have never seen so much avocado on toast!! I had to scrap off what seemed like an entire avocado worth. After finishing my meal and placing napkins over my plate I still could not get my servers attention to get a bill or to say anything. I eventually came to the counter to ask if I pay here. I got a "sure" although I think I saw others receive a bill at the table. When they asked how my food was I said the drink was overwhelmingly ginger and I just got a "oh yeah sorry" and that was it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

XKK28xjxCZsV35pxJls-vA.text: Great place for breakfast or lunch--especially if you're looking for something light and healthy. They probably have the best avocado toast I've ever had. It was served on sourdough toast and had a subtle kick. Wouldn't necessarily recommend the acai bowl.  Bonus: Checking in seems to get you 10% off!

_RxsPdZ15uEXitT_E4QMrg.text: After some heavy meals this was such a perfect way to start the mornings in Edinburgh. We came here back to back mornings as this place really was a welcomed change. The healthy smoothie and acai bowls were so delicious and nutritious. The maca nana bowl may honestly be one of my favorite smoothie bowls of ALL TIME! The mix of vanilla, bananas, maca and almond milk is such a delicious base and then top it with blueberries, granola and the ever crave worthy peanut butter, this is complete happiness! Wowza! So happy this place was steps from our hotel!

T8tCl_TAxh-KJzg40cWI3w.text: The service was great, all the servers were lovely but the food was only okay. I got the vegan chilli and the amount of guacamole and cacao nibs just turned it into this weird lumpy mush. I'd like to try something else next time.

lGWussvU4cSEWt8CoY5i6w.text: The menu had a lot of vegan, gluten, dairy free options which was great. The juice I ordered mostly tasted like apples, and it was supposed to have ginger and other ingredients.   The service was a little scattered. Our orders were taken incorrectly, but quickly fixed! I did enjoy the flavor of the food, very yummy.   I would go back, maybe it was just a busy afternoon and the service wouldn't usually be so scattered.

R0Xtm53FtL3UuVRvUahZag.text: After eating pub grub for two weeks, I was craving something different. So, my husband allowed me to be #Basic and we tried Hula's avocado toast . We added bacon and it was fantastic. I got fresh squeezed orange juice as well as coffee. Juice was great- coffee was decent. (I'm from Seattle so perhaps my standards are high?) We also ordered the salmon and soft cheese sandwich. It was served warm which was surprising and the salmon was a little fishy. I would not order it again. Next time I'd order 2 avocado toasts- one with salmon and one with bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Avocado toast with bacon

BzdAdfqKLgrLzDXh1OOAAA.text: Hula Juice Cafe is home to the best avocado toast I've ever had! I got mine with smoked salmon on it, and I loved the combination of tomato oil, avocado, chili flakes/seeds/salt, greens and lime. It was so flavorful and had a tiny bit of a kick thanks to the chili flakes. The smoked salmon was definitely worth the added 1.50. I also got the Pink Lady juice, which is a blended juice of apple, lemon, lime and ginger. It was a nice refreshing drink that soothed my post-flight stomach. The cafe is pretty big, although a little cramped, but you shouldn't have any trouble seating a few people around lunch time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

YxHT_KyHOAoEOJnV2Zi_wg.text: This was a cute spot my friend and I hit twice within our 3 day stay in Edinburgh. The ambiance was great and the place seemed clean enough. It is lively and will get busy very quickly! Note that they have extra seating in the back.   We tried the avocado toast, several smoothies, and the acai bowl. The bowl was kind of small and our smoothies weren't as cold as I would have liked, but they were okay.   The avocado toast was yummy - the chili/tomato paste they use as a base was a much-needed addition. I wish they would use more of it. They give a very generous amount of avocado. The second time it was almost an unreasonable amount of avocado for the size of the toasts . Perhaps order an extra piece of toast if you want an easier time eating it. The only thing I wish the avo toast featured was a unique garnish that would zest it up. Maybe some spicy pickled onions or some lime.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Avocado toast

tod5MlksLTKqm18TpudaHQ.text: Neither the soup nor the service were great. The coffee was great. Granola was solid. The decor was quite cute, but the food itself was fine- nothing special, but not bad either!

Ydi1RBooQNc4r5KnFlDMzQ.text: I came here back in the spring and they have a wholeee lot of awesome options! (I wanted to eat the whole menu!)  I tried ordering their avocado toast, but unfortunately, they didn't have that at the time--no matter though, because everything else on their menu looks amazing! I've had their acai bowl (vegan + gluten-free, with a blend of acai, banana, strawberries, blueberries + coconut milk and topped with toasted coconut shavings, chia seeds, blueberries, cacao nibs, gluten-free granola + banana slices), and also their sriracha chicken wrap, which I took along with me to a hike up Arthur's Seat.  Their Sunshine In A Cup smoothie (also vegan + gluten-free) has mangoes, peaches, pineapples, and oranges in it. :] Definitely was an awesome way to start the day!   I have no idea how I managed to miss the fact that they have poke bowls here, because I would've jumped on that otherwise! *-*  The juice bar has a very casual and friendly vibe, not unlike the cafes in Hawai'i where I got my acai bowls the year before! They're open every day from 8am-6pm, and are an awesome place to check out for breakfast, lunch, or a snack! Indoor + outdoor seating available! :]

OVWIEyFDv7_U0Q62YAsYgw.text: A taste of home! I really enjoyed the selection and food quality at Hula. The restaurant has a California. The ambiance is fun and bright. I ordered the avocado toast and a coffee. The toast was piled high with avocado and seasoned perfectly. The meal was so fantastic that my friends even went back for lunch (I would have if I had more time, but I wanted to try something new). If you are craving some trendy/ California/ Hawaii inspired food I would recommend dining at Hula!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

qXHBk-89_8mgw1fh-iyvSQ.text: Really good food. Absolutely love this place. Also the interior design is pretty! Staff is super friendly. Highly recommend if you like healthier options. It is really delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

o_jP4tLUCAQU-AAZZF1Few.text: Loved the vibes of this place! Very cute indoor seating and the location was beautiful. Would love to sit outside on a warm day. I tried the acai bowl, which was only 5 pounds takeaway. Coming from California I've had many an acai bowl and, though this one was not the best I've ever had, it the best one I've had in Edinburgh yet. Very filling and satisfying for a relatively low price. Will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The acai bowl to go.

QtnNC9qKGLa5gvXuyaDZAg.text: I absolutely love this place! I found it on my last visit in May and have been craving it for months!!  Best avocado toast (a HEALTHY portion!)  I had the acai bowl last time but with peanut butter  so amazing!!  Also have ordered the matcha tea latte with almond milk. Heavenly!  Ordered fresh pressed carrot juice this time and am so happy yes again!   If you have a healthy side (or even if you don't,) you won't be disappointed! My favorite healthy spot in Edinburgh

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

isN7HNneDZ8JUdVjsMXIuQ.text: Misty rain this a.m. in Old Town and thus I was in search of warm comfort food but should I go for full Scottish breakfast that sounded either one step above or below Denny's in U.S. or little place down the street; since the former is a bar whose server is not to be found, to Hula I went. I ask the server at 9:30 a.m. if it was too early to get soup and she says, "It's never too early for soup!" My kind of place. I ordered a chicken corn chowder which seems to have pureed potatoes as part of the soup base and comes with great thick slices of crusty grain bread and butter. Yummy and just the thing to warm up with.  Later in the day, I returned for a large Orange & mango smoothies w/ energy boost. This too was good. The business has a great vibe with locals, international visitors speaking multiple languages, friendly staff, good eats, and wifi. This was another place I was lucky to stumble upon that I remembered reading about in Yelper Jenny L's reviews.  Well worth checking out.

YOgJlkkndJi1Gl4_I_hD4g.text: Yum, got to love a good smoothie. Whoever got the idea, however long ago, to blend fruit and other dairy products together to make an amazing taste concoction and in the process make being healthy appeal to everyone...well, they're clearly pretty awesome. I don't know how anyone can say they don't like fruit, when the magic of a blender can sort you out with any combination of edible items you like in a tasty juicetastic form.   Hula does in fact feel a bit Hawaiian, or like a cafe you'd go to abroad at any rate, and it has a really cool vibe to it, with equally cool and banterful staff. If you want a really good choice of smoothies, then this is your place, plus they serve decent food if you're peckish.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula Juice Cafe - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Photo from hulagood.com

LCway8m5dMGJjvY24Ye_tA.text: Went for brunch before departure from Edinburgh after reading the positive reviews on Yelp. Cute place and comfy seating. The porridge was very nice and good as breakfast. Service was not bad as well.

3H6gFyQv1_AUh9ToRL_9Eg.text: Hoorah! Ok, yes, lame wordpun, I'm Dutch, go with it.  So, after a long absence I went by Hula again for a proper juice and lo-and-behold: they have changed the chairs and benches to fit people of my legginess! Ooooh. I am a very, very happy camper indeed.  I had the soup and my girl-date had the bagel with added bacon, nom, and the Pink Lady Juice. It was absolutely hilarious to see her geek out over such delicious flavours, as she had never been to Hula before. I think the terms "Seventh Heaven" and "Organic Squee" were mentioned. I'm pretty sure that Hula has a new regular customer!  My soup was lovely, and my Dutch sensibilities were sufficiently freaked out by eating soup out of a bowl on a slope (this is scary to me, my country is flat) to not notice the somewhat less comfy seating outside on the terrace.  I love this place, and what they stand for. The healthiness of it, the organic nature. I love it. What's not to love? I'll clearly be back again.  If I'd have to suggest something, it'd be that the waiting staff, though lovely, needs some organisation. There was no menu for us to order at the counter, and the waiting staff seemed incredibly frazzled running all over the place, but it was a Saturday, and that might have been why. Either way, they're friendly, if a little frazzled, and that's all I care about. Go here? STAY here, that's my advice.

vDg14Ebd_tXlWsnUWh19tQ.text: Love this place.  Happy helpful staff. Healthy delicious smoothies. Tasty soups and lunchtime snacks. Lunch deal a bargain for soup and a wrap, or bagel with choice of fillings. Nice coffee well made.

TwMBnOSOLHiAdXyRd9xtXQ.text: Second time in - first since the redesign- and didn't disappoint food-wise.  Smoked salmon bagel and the granola, yogurt and banana really good.  The fresh juice was nice - I went for a carrot, orange and ginger combo- though I'm not a fan of lots of sediment in my juices so took a bit of dental sieving to finish it off.  I really need to toughen up!!       Obviously Hula is as popular as ever, mobbed today (bank holiday Monday) and perhaps the only real downside was I felt the staff were running to stand still.  My juice arrived after I'd finished my bagel and my partner's coffee midway through her breakfast.  Staff were very apologetic about the wait and you could tell this wasn't the norm.    Looking forward to my next visit - this really is an oasis in an otherwise fairly arid Cafe landscape.

kgSc_-yLqIB4B2MhrhrLRg.text: Had a wonderful breakfast here this morning after having just arrived from the airport. It was exactly what we needed to start our day in Edinburgh. The porridge was amazing and the juices were delicious. We loved the Popeye juice and the Tahiti smoothie! The toast and coffee also looked great so we are planning to return for breakfast tomorrow!

oef_Nv6ND_JEAGbe0kXNWA.text: What a nice place to have a special meal done with an artistic touch, served with an exotic juice, to make you feel the indulgence of the city. Orders are served particularly fast.

IHp1ZC6Kpeyi5rW_1N7Nmg.text: My flatmate and I go here sometimes three times a week because it's always guaranteed to be good. The toasted bagel sandwiches are the best and with soup for the lunch deal, it's quite a bargain!

gzfA9OgAvCm0E-AGlf4OvQ.text: This is a great little juice bar with some good food too. It's a great place to grab a quick breakfast before exploring grassmarket. Try the Betty Ford smoothie!

5tH85gMmP-5z3LWNGAPfcQ.text: I was tired, hungry, and cranky when I wandered into Hula, and just wanted to get some tea and rest for a little. Instead I got not only tea, but just about the best vegetable soup I've ever had, as well as an amazing cake (and I left in a much better mood). I loved Hula so much that I ended up going back again before I left Edinburgh. Everything is amazing, the food, the smoothies, the atmosphere. I would highly recommend it.

11UmXzVTEFM1cxBEpVVZ0w.text: I walked by it one day and was like this place looks awesome and actually later that day I was with a walking tour and we stopped there.  Really great customer service, and the Espresso Macchiato was really good too, I bet this place makes you smile when you walk in on a cold, wet day.  I could see myself being a regular if I lived nearby.

GtFmntXkAqa_-3dZAUfN4w.text: Great little place, the outside looks a bit naff and cheap tbh but the inside has comfy seats, cool art on the walls and the food is both interesting, good value for money and most importantly Tasty! The staff are not too bad either :-)

9iPkuxVLo00OD-_I7zMj_A.text: We were lucky to get a seat, the place was packed! I had a lovely lentil and bacon soup with freshly baked bread and pot of green tea. This cafe has a quaint relaxed feel, my deck chair was a little uncomfortable as the pillow I was sat on had long past its best. It's also a little cramped, which makes it awkward for customers trying to get past tables to find a seat. The staff were very friendly and attentive, I also think its value for money. While they do advertise free WiFi, I couldn't access it at the back if the cafe. I'm still giving them 4 stars as the proof is in the number of customers they had in and the quality of their food was excellent.

SwHxAUwadEB5uebnbe4pcw.text: Feeling a little parched and devoid of vitamins I thought I'd rely on Hula to perk me up with their fruity offerings.  True to form they supplied me with a flavour packed glass of what they call 'Sunshine in a cup'. Its potent mango, orange and passion fruit mix complimented by some smooth and creamy yoghurt perked me up good and proper.
